alert.note: Alert for Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Sawyer County through 345 PM CDT... At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Winter, to Exeland, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Sawyer County, including the following locations... Deer Lake, Ojibwa, Edgewater and Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
